SEARCH
Module org.myjtools.jexten
Package org.myjtools.jexten

Annotation Interface Extension

@Retention(RUNTIME) @Target(TYPE) public @interface Extension
This annotation allows to mark a class as an extension managed by the ExtensionManager.

Notice that any class not annotated with Extension will not be managed in spite of implementing or extending the ExtensionPoint class.

  • Optional Element Summary

    Optional Elements
    Modifier and Type
    Optional Element
    Description
    String
    extensionPoint
    The qualified type name of the extension point that is extended.
    String
    extensionPointVersion
    The minimum version of the extension point that is extended in form of <majorVersion>.<minorVersion> .
    Class<? extends ExtensionLoader>
    loadedWith
    A custom extension loader that will be used to load the extension.
    String
    name
    A specific name to identify this extension for injection purposes
    Priority
    priority
    The priority level used when multiple extensions implement the same extension point.
    Scope
    scope
    The lifecycle scope that determines how extension instances are created and managed.

  • Element Details

    • extensionPoint

      String extensionPoint
      The qualified type name of the extension point that is extended.

      If this field is not provided and the extension class implements directly the extension point class, it will automatically infer the value as the qualified name of the extension point class. Notice that, if the extension point class uses generic parameters, the inference mechanism will not work, so clients must provide the class directly in those cases.

      Empty string is used as non-defined value

      Default:
      ""

    • extensionPointVersion

      String extensionPointVersion
      The minimum version of the extension point that is extended in form of <majorVersion>.<minorVersion> .

      If an incompatible version is used (that is, the major part of the version is different), the extension manager will emit a warning and prevent the extension from loading.

      Default:
      "1.0"

    • priority

      Priority priority
      The priority level used when multiple extensions implement the same extension point.

      When retrieving a single extension via ExtensionManager.getExtension(Class), the extension with the highest priority is selected. When retrieving all extensions, they are sorted by priority (highest first).

      Returns:
      the priority level for this extension
      See Also:
      • Priority
      Default:
      NORMAL

    • scope

      Scope scope
      The lifecycle scope that determines how extension instances are created and managed.
      • Scope.SINGLETON - One instance shared globally across the application
      • Scope.SESSION - One instance per ExtensionManager request context
      • Scope.TRANSIENT - New instance created for every request
      Returns:
      the lifecycle scope for this extension
      See Also:
      • Scope
      Default:
      SESSION

    • loadedWith

      Class<? extends ExtensionLoader> loadedWith
      A custom extension loader that will be used to load the extension. Generally, this is only necessary for extensions designed to be integrated with some external IoC mechanism.
      Default:
      org.myjtools.jexten.ExtensionLoader.class

    • name

      String name
      A specific name to identify this extension for injection purposes
      Default:
      ""
